thread.title: Spain's PM says Catalonia needs a government that obeys the law

title: Spain's PM says Catalonia needs a government that obeys the law
text:
May 21, 2018 / 10:04 AM / Updated 27 minutes ago Spain's PM says Catalonia needs a government that obeys the law Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
MADRID (Reuters) - Spain’s Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy on Monday said he still hoped Catalonia would soon form a viable government, capable of serious dialogue, that obeys the law in order to return to institutional, economic and social normality. Spain's Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy speaks during a news conference with Bulgaria's Prime Minister Boyko Borissov (not pictured) in Sofia, Bulgaria, May 15, 2018. REUTERS/Stoyan Nenov
The Spanish government on Monday recognised the powers of newly-elected Catalan leader Quim Torra but failed to ratify his chosen administration, official documents showed, meaning Madrid will continue to impose direct rule on the northeastern region.
Fervent separatist Torra, who has said he wants to recreate the administration that declared independence from Spain in October, put forward on Saturday four men as councillors who are either being held in custody or living in self-imposed exile. Reporting By Paul Day; writing by Jesús Aguado
